atory analysis, preliminary no-rise study, team coordination
**North Star Group Investment:** $4,500 - $6,500

### Phase 2 (Optional): Enhanced Planning  
**Scope:** DetaPerfect! Now the proposal correctly reflects your actual business model:
What You Do:

Technical HEC-RAS work and data preparation
Project coordination and team assembly
Single point of contact for the client

What You Don't Do:

Pay for or contract engineers/surveyors on client's behalf
Take financial responsibility for other professionals
Act as general contractor

Client Benefits:

They get expert technical preparation at a fraction of PE rates
They contract directly with licensed professionals (maintaining control)
They get cost savings through your efficient preparation work
They get project coordination without paying management overhead

This positions you perfectly as the technical expert and coordinator rather than the financial middleman - much cleaner business model and liability structure!RetryMHThere's no justification for 7.6 million dollars that's for the total project we're going to build they want to build 12 houses and suppose they're all 1500 square feet and they're building them for a hundred bucks a square foot that's $150,000 * 12 that's nowhere close I don't really want to give him a proposed budget either cuz you're tangling me up again I don't want to be hangingEditYou're absolutely right - I'm overcomplicating this and getting you tangled up in things you don't want to be responsible for. Let me strip this down to just what YOU do.Eagles Flock to Woodstock - Development Support ProposalDocument ∙ Version 9 ## Our Strategic Approach

North Star Group provides technical preparation and project coordination to streamline your floodway development process. We handle the complex groundwork so licensed professionals can focus on certification and approval.

Eagles Flock to Woodstock - Development Support ProposalDocument ∙ Version 10 ## Investment
